article:
(1513-1798).]] The 26 'cantons of Switzerland' are the member states of the
 federal state of Switzerland. Each canton was a fully sovereign
 state with its own border controls, army and currency from the
 Treaty of Westphalia (1648) until the establishment of the Swiss federal state
 in 1848. The most recently created canton is the Canton of Jura, which
 separated from the Canton of Bern in 1979.

The name is derived from the French language word [[:fr:canton|canton]] meaning
corner or district (from which the term Cantonment is also derived).
